Module com.example.breakout_clone
Package com.example.breakout_clone.controller.game

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.example.breakout_clone.controller.game.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
This class is the main controller for the game, which handles all the user input when playing the game.

This class has been built from the GameFrame and the Wall class taking the method that handles the inputs

This class is the controller to the GameView.fxml

Author:
Praket Chavan - modified
See Also:
GameModel

      private javafx.scene.control.Label getScore()

      Returns:
      the Label object that shows the game score

    • gameTimer

      private void gameTimer()
      Runs an iteration of the game loop. It moves the sprites on the screen by calling the GameModel.move() models move method.
      It handles the impacts by calling the ImpactHandler.handleImpacts() method of the model ImpactHandler. It calls checks for whether the ball has been lost and calls the appropriate methods. It checks if the player has finished the level and calls the appropriate methods.
      See Also:
      onGameOver(), onGameComplete()

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      This method is called automatically when the view is created. It initialises the model object and created the AnimationTimer that runs the gameLoop.
      This calls methods the initializeBinding() method to initialise the binding between the view objects and the respective model property.
      Calls the initializeListener() to add listeners to some model list properties.

    • initializeBinding

      private void initializeBinding()
      Binds the view objects with the respective model properties to allow the view to listen to changes to the model and update itself.
      See Also:
      initialize()

    • initializeListener

      private void initializeListener()
      Adds the change listeners to observable list in the model.
      See Also:
      initialize()

    • nextLevel

      private void nextLevel()
      Checks to see if the model has any more levels. If it does then stops the level music and plays the next level music and starts the next level.
      Also starts the animation for the LevelComplete Label
      See Also:
      GameModel.hasNextLevel(), GameModel.nextLevel()

    • onGameComplete

      private void onGameComplete()
      Creates the GameCompleteView and replaces the GameView scene with it

    • onGameOver

      private void onGameOver()
      Creates the GameOverView and replaces the GameView scene with it

    • onKeyPressed

      private void onKeyPressed​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Listens to the user input when the game timer starts and calls the method from the model depending on the input
      Parameters:
      event - the key event that the user inputted

    • onKeyReleased

      private void onKeyReleased​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Listens for when the user stops pressing a key and stops the player
      Parameters:
      event - the KeyEvent inputted by the user
